title: Center of mass - three sphere and rod system

content.question: A system consists of three uniform spheres connected by a uniform rod passing through the center of each sphere. The rod has a length of <math alttext="2.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext></mstyle></math> and mass of <math alttext="1.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math>, and the spheres have a mass of <math alttext="1.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math>, <math alttext="3.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> located in positions as shown. What is the distance between the center of the <math alttext="3.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> sphere and the center of mass of the system?
